meanings.definition: Unwilling or unable to believe something
meanings.sent1: She looked incredulous when I told her about the talking dog.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's incredulous expression showed she doubted the student's excuse.
meanings.sent3: His incredulous reaction to the magic trick made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The idea of time travel seemed incredulous to the young boy.
meanings.sent5: The incredulous look on her face was unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The detective's incredulous expression hinted at his suspicions.
meanings.sent2: The audience was incredulous at the magician's disappearing act.
meanings.sent3: His incredulous reaction to the prank was priceless.
meanings.sent4: The news of the alien sighting left everyone incredulous.
meanings.sent5: Her incredulous tone made it clear she didn't believe the story.
